professionalSummary: Highly motivated Systems Engineer and Technical Project Manager with more than 4 years of experience integrating robotics, AI, and computer vision systems. Proven track record of leading cross-functional teams, coordinating complex automation projects, and delivering innovative solutions on time and under budget for high-tech manufacturing environments.

experience.title: Senior Development Engineer
responsibilities: Develop and implement generative AI solutions using VLM/LLM models for zero-shot and few-shot inspection with minimal configuration via prompt engineering
Deploy multi-agentic workflow and optimize local VLM/LLM models for data security and efficient edge inference for manufacturing inspection applications
Lead architecture design and guide junior engineers in developing a smart adaptive inspection system for optimal camera selection in diverse inspection scenarios
Automate production processes and inspection systems using Robotics and Machine Intelligence for pharmaceutical and fast-moving consumer goods industries

experience.title: Application & Computer Vision Engineer
responsibilities: Spearheaded system integration of back-end server with multiple industrial robots (ABB, UR, KUKA) for automated toolpath generation
Led technical troubleshooting and on-site support locally and overseas, managing stakeholder communication and resolving critical system-level issues
Implemented project timelines and coordinated with cross-disciplinary teams to launch a deep learning defect detection system, automating aerospace remanufacturing processes

experience.title: Research & Development Engineer
experience.company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
responsibilities: Managed end-to-end project lifecycles for large-area inspection solutions using collaborative robots and mobile platforms (ROS-based)
Oversaw integration of AI-driven vision systems and NDT technologies, ensuring seamless operation across mechanical, electrical, and software components
Published 2 papers and achieved 7 research inventions as main/co-inventor in robotics and AI applications for manufacturing

experience.title: Tech Lead & Co-Mechanical Lead (Undergraduate Research Team)
responsibilities: Directed a team of 30 engineers to design and build autonomous underwater vehicles, managing schedules, resource allocation, and risk assessments
Coordinated simulation, system integration, and testing for competition-ready robotics systems, achieving international recognition

awards: JTC-NUS Gold Medal (Most Innovative FYP) – Robotic Eye Surgery
First Place at NUS IEEE Hackathon

education.degree: Diploma in Aerospace Technology (with Business Minor)

honorsAwards: JTC-NUS Gold Medal for Final Year Project – Robotic Eye Surgery Mechanism Design
NUS IEEE Hackathon – Best Innovative & Mind-blowing Hack
Multiple academic awards in innovation, engineering design, and leadership
